items.content_html: The best dream tonight: Boarding a small charter plane on the Mediterranean and flying through a thunderstorm with a few others as Mount Etna erupted and embers rained down on the rising plane. I felt physically younger in the dream, yes, in deed, that made all the difference and made this a very pleasant dream: just the feeling of not being petrified in a body permanently on alert was so liberating that the rest was rather so “oh, really?”.
items.content_text: The best dream tonight: Boarding a small charter plane on the Mediterranean and flying through a thunderstorm with a few others as Mount Etna erupted and embers rained down on the rising plane. I felt physically younger in the dream, yes, in deed,  that made all the difference and made this a very pleasant dream: just the feeling of not being petrified in a body permanently on alert was so liberating that the rest was rather so "oh, really?".

items.content_html:
Finished reading: Lob des Schattens by Jun’ichir≈ç Tanizaki üìö

Ein Essay √ºber die √Ñsthetik des Schattens von 1933.

Irritierend sind die √úberlegungen, warum der Schatten insbesondere in der japanischen Kultur den Menschen quasi eingeschrieben sei, da die erwogenen Antworten rassi(sti)sche und biologische Qualit√§ten heranziehen. Da der Schatten aber gleichwohl im Zentrum einer der (kolonialistischen) Verwestlichung entgegengestellten Gegenbewegung gestellt wird, ist dies zeitkritisch nachvollziehbar.

An essay on the aesthetics of the shadow from 1933. The reflections on why the shadow is virtually inscribed in people, especially in Japanese culture, are irritating, since the answers considered draw on racial and biological qualities. However, since the shadow is nevertheless placed at the centre of a counter-movement opposed to (colonialist) westernisation, this is understandable from a time-critical point of view.
